pages.text: Are you tired of looking for minerals like $(thing)gypsum$() to build or $(thing)kaolinite$() and $(thing)graphite$() to make your $(l:mechanics/blast_furnace)Blast Furnace$(), but keep finding metals? You're in luck, as the $(thing)Mineral Prospector$() can help!

pages.title: Mineral Prospector
pages.text: The Mineral Prospector is a variation on the classic $(l:mechanics/prospecting)Prospector's Pick$(). However, instead of reporting any nearby ores, it only reports $(t:Non-metal ores)minerals$() in the 45x45x45 area centered on the clicked block.
A Mineral Prospector Head Mold can be $(l:getting_started/pottery)knapped$() from clay, as seen above.
A Mineral Prospector Head can also be smithed out of a $(thing)double ingot$() of any tool metal on an $(l:mechanics/anvils)Anvil$(). Craft the tool head with a stick to make a Mineral Prospector
